title: Arctic Weather Satellite: advancing weather forecasting in a changing climate
summary: The effects of the climate crisis are felt more acutely in the Arctic than anywhere else on the planet. The weather in the Arctic is not only severe, but it changes extremely quickly. More frequent data are urgently needed to improve weather forecasts for this susceptible polar region.

title: Lessons Learned from Challenger and Columbia Guide Starliner Decisions
summary: NASA continues to analyze data about Starliner’s propulsion system before deciding if the Boeing spacecraft is safe enough to bring two NASA astronauts back to Earth from the International Space […]

title: Sols 4275-4276: A Familiar View
summary: Earth planning date: Wednesday, Aug. 14, 2024 The star of today’s plan is SAM’s GCMS, which continues our analysis of the “Kings Canyon” drill sample. title: Sols 4273-4274: Prep Rally
summary: Earth planning date: Monday, Aug. 12, 2024 The SAM EGA over the weekend was successful, and that means we’re well on our way to planning the GCMS (Gas Chromatograph Mass Spectrometry) on our “Kings Canyon” drill sample! GCMS is an energy-intensive activity, so we’ll be using today’s two-sol plan mainly for recharging our battery and […]

title: Redwire to acquire satellite manufacturer Hera Systems, bolstering defense portfolio
summary: Hera Systems developed a geostationary small satellite platform selected for a U.S. Space Force in-orbit refueling experiment

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 2nd pair of Maxar’s WorldView Legion satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The mission marks the 200th Falcon 9 launch from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station. Liftoff is set for the opening of a 60-minute window at 9 a.m. EDT (1300 UTC).

title: NASA pushes Starliner return decision to late August
summary: NASA now expects to make a decision by late August on whether NASA astronauts will return on Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft as the agency outlined the process it will take to reach that decision.

title: Wildland Fire Management Initiative Description
summary: Background Fire is a natural occurrence in many ecosystems and can promote ecological health. However, wildfires are growing in scope and occurring more often than in the past. Among other causes this is due to human-caused climate impacts and the expansion of communities into areas with wildland vegetation. These blazes continue to significantly harm communities, […]

title: Why NASA astronauts are waiting to return on Boeing’s Starliner
Telesat close to securing government funds for Lightspeed
summary: Telesat expects to finalize government funds covering more than half the $3.5 billion budget for its planned low Earth orbit broadband constellation “in the next couple of weeks,” CEO Dan Goldberg said Aug. 14.
